faqs.question: What is the minimum shareholding at Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: As determined during the Annual General Meeting, the minimum shareholding for individual members is 200 shares, or Ksh 20,000, while the minimum shareholding for corporations/chamas is 500 shares, or Ksh 50,000. The administration has established a schedule for the purchase of shares for each savings plan: Bronze in 36 months, Silver in 24 months, Gold in 12 months, Platinum in 6 months, and Emerald in one month from the date of registration.

faqs.question: Can I use my shares to secure a loan?
faqs.answer: No, shares cannot be used as collateral for a loan. The Sacco's capital includes shares, allowing it to invest in infrastructure and ICT, among other things.

faqs.question: Can I purchase more than the minimum shareholding?
faqs.answer: Yes, you may purchase more shares than the minimum if you do not exceed a fifth of the total membership shareholding. At the conclusion of the fiscal year 2021, the total membership shareholding amounted to 101,673 shares, or Ksh 10,167,308.

faqs.question: Are my shares insured?
faqs.answer: No, shares are not insured.

faqs.question: Why do I need shares?
faqs.answer: By law, Saccos may only conduct commerce with their shareholders, who are also their only customers. Consequently, every Sacco customer must also be a shareholder.

faqs.question: What was the last dividend payout at Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: Since its inception, Mombo Sacco has not distributed dividends to its members. This is the consequence of a member's decision at the Annual General Meeting to retain the entire Sacco surplus in order to capitalize the business to a level of 30%. Mombo Sacco's core capital amounted to 16% at the end of the fiscal year 2021.

faqs.question: Can I convert my savings to shares?
faqs.answer: No, the regulator prohibits Saccos from converting members' savings into shares.

faqs.question: What are Mombo Sacco shares?
faqs.answer: The shares represent a member's co-ownership interest in Mombo Sacco's equity.Members of Mombo Sacco are required to purchase a minimum of Ksh 20,000 worth of 200 shares.

faqs.question: What is a dividend?
faqs.answer: A dividend is the portion of the society's surplus that is distributed to its members in accordance with a resolution passed at the Annual General Meeting.

faqs.question: Are my shares refundable?
faqs.answer: Your shares are refundable upon death or withdrawal from membership for a modest fee equal to 20% of the value of the outstanding shares.

faqs.question: How many points do I earn for my first Momboversary?
faqs.answer: Momboversary refers to 12 months of saving the minimum saving amount in any of the saving plans with Mombo Sacco, effective January 2023. The points will be calculated monthly and accrued at the end of the 12 months. The bronze saving plan will attract 25 points. One hundred points, 250 points, 500 points, and 1500 points for Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Emerald saving plans, respectively.

faqs.question: How much m-rewards do I earn as an annual top saver?
faqs.answer: Annual top savers are members who have gained the most top monthly savers in each of the 5-tier flexible saving plans over the course of a calendar year. The Bronze annual top saver will receive Ksh 3000. The top savers in the categories of Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Emerald will receive 12,000, 18,000, 24,000, and 36,000 Kenyan shillings, accordingly.

faqs.question: Do I my M-rewards expire?
faqs.answer: Yes. Your M-Rewards expire three years after the month in which they were earned.

faqs.question: What is M-Rewards?
faqs.answer: This is Mombo Sacco's rewards program, which provides clients with cash bonuses for certain qualifying transactions.

faqs.question: How much M-Rewards do I earn when I refer friends and family?
faqs.answer: Everyone benefits from a successful Mombo Sacco registration. The referrer and recipient of a Bronze membership referral will receive Ksh 100 and Ksh 30, respectively. Ksh 500 and Ksh 200 for Silver membership. Ksh 750 and Ksh 400; Ksh 1,500 and Ksh 250; and Ksh 1,750 and Ksh 250 for Gold, Platinum, and Emerald, respectively.

faqs.question: How do I earn M-rewards?
faqs.answer: No need to enroll; we got you. Earning M-rewards is as straightforward as making payments or performing routine tasks such as upgrading your savings plan, referring your friends and family, and making contributions to your savings account.

faqs.question: What types of items can I redeem my points for?
faqs.answer: You may redeem your points in four categories: travel, cash, gift cards, and charitable donations.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the M-Rewards program?
faqs.answer: Everyone who has a Mombo app account is eligible to participate. There is no enrollment required.

faqs.question: Can M-Rewards be gifted or transfered to another Mombo account holder?
faqs.answer: Yes. You may transfer M-Rewards to another account at no cost. Gifted rewards expire twelve months after the date of transfer.

faqs.question: How can I redeem my cash rewards?
faqs.answer: Here comes the fun portion. Tap the M-Rewards menu item in the upper left corner, followed by the cash redemption icon. Explore all of your options, including Cash back, gift vouchers, hotel, travel, and charitable donations.

faqs.question: How do I view and redeem m-rewards?
faqs.answer: To view and redeem m-rewards, select the menu icon in the upper-left corner of the Mombo App, followed by the M-Rewards menu. Additionally, you can monitor the progress of contests by tapping the Earn Rewards button.

faqs.question: How much m-rewards do I earn upgrading a saving plan?
faqs.answer: Whenever you upgrade your savings plan, you can earn m-rewards. The reward of upgrading to the Silver savings plan is Ksh 500. In addition, you will receive Ksh 1,000, Ksh 1,500, and Ksh 2,000, respectively, when you graduate to Gold, Platinum, and Emerald.

faqs.question: How much m-rewards do I earn as a monthly top saver?
faqs.answer: The monthly best savers are the members who have saved the most in each of the primary 5-tier flexible saving plans. The Bronze top saver will receive Ksh 100. The highest savers in Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Emerald will receive 250, 450, 650, and 900 points, respectively.

faqs.question: How much m-rewards do I earn when I make payments?
faqs.answer: You will accumulate m-rewards based on the number of monthly payment transactions you complete. Two to five payment transactions will yield you 10 Kenyan Shillings. Six to forty transactions will yield you fifty Kenyan shillings. You will earn 100 Kenyan shillings when you complete 41 to 100 payment transactions. Finally, transactions over 100 will yield you 200 Kenyan Shillings.

faqs.question: Are loans insured?
faqs.answer: All Mombo Sacco loans are 100% life-insured. In the unfortunate event of a borrower's demise, Sacco shall recover the outstanding loan from the insurance.

faqs.question: How does the 50% loan installment interest discount work?
faqs.answer:
To assist our members, when a loan is originated after 25th March 2020, loan installments settled early would attract up to a 50% interest discount. This would enable you to save more and, in essence, allow you to experience the most affordable loans in Kenya.
For instance, if a loan installment interest is Ksh 3,000, you'll automatically get a Ksh 1500 discount in case you settle the installment by 50% duration of the installment.

Refer to a loan account to view the installment's 50% discount in action.

faqs.question: Can I change my loan installment repayment dates?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can. The day is automatically set to 30 days after your loan is approved, but you're welcome to pick a more convenient one.
To change your loan installment repayment day, log into your Mombo app, tap on loan services, and then date restructure. Once there, follow the steps on the screen.
Things to keep in mind:
a. You'll always need to pick a date at least seven (7) days in the future.
b. There is a convenience fee charged. We do this to adjust for the change in interest payable caused by the increased number of days from your original repayment day to your new repayment day. (Don't worry; it's a one-off! Your repayments won't be affected.)
c. You won't be able to change your repayment day if: you've missed one or more repayments or have defaulted on your loan.

faqs.question: Can I get a loan?
faqs.answer:
Yes, Mombo Sacco offers loans around-the-clock. Here are several prerequisites for obtaining a loan:
a. Must be a member of Mombo Sacco.
b. Must have saved money within the past three months.
c. Must provide evidence of financial capability.

If you are already a member of Mombo Sacco, you can examine your loan limits by tapping the apply loan icon.

faqs.question: Do I qualify for a salary advance loan?
faqs.answer: All employed Mombo Sacco members who have saved at least Ksh 15,000 are eligible for a salary advance. In addition, you will be required to submit certain documents for the credit team to evaluate your credit profile and establish a loan limit. Tap the upload documents icon on the homepage to submit the necessary documents, or contact customer support at +254706 503230 or support@mombo.africa for assistance.

faqs.question: What is Savings-Secured loans?
faqs.answer:
It can take a long time to build up your savings and a short time to spend. With Savings-Secured Loans, you can use your savings as security, borrow at economical rates, and keep your savings intact. 

Mombo Sacco offers four types of Savings-Secured Loans:

a. Insta loan – 1 month to 6 months tenor to individual members.
b. Lifestyle Access loan – 7 months to 84 months tenor to individual members.
c. Imarika Loan - 13 months to 84 months tenor to group/M-Chama members.
d. Nawiri Loan - 1 month - 12 months tenor to group/M-Chama members.

Preserve hard-earned savings - borrow against your wealth instead of spending it.

faqs.question: Can I refinance/top up my existing loan?
faqs.answer:
Great. Tap the 'Consolidation' button under loan services to consolidate an existing loan.
There are a few conditions, and it has to have been at least six (6) months since you took the loan to be refinanced.
Please be aware that a settlement amount is automatically taken from your account when you take out a new loan with us. This means that the remaining balance of your loan, any fees, and interest due are deducted from your new loan amount.

For example: If you borrowed Ksh500,000, and your current limit is Ksh 800,000, then you have up to Ksh300,000 left to borrow.
Please be aware that a settlement amount is automatically taken from your account when you take out a new loan with us. This means that the remaining balance of your loan, any fees, and interest due are deducted from your new loan amount.

For example: If your remaining Mombo loan balance is Ksh100,000 and you applied for a new Ksh 300,000 loan. Let's say the amount of your service charge is Ksh 9,000. The remaining balance of your original loan (Ksh100,000) and any costs payable (Ksh 9,000) will be deducted before you are credited with the remaining disbursal amount.
Using the above example, your loan disbursal amount is Ksh 191,000.

faqs.question: What loan security is acceptable?
faqs.answer: You can use either your own savings to guarantee loans that are equal to or less of your savings, or a mix of your savings, guarantor savings, or collateral to secure a loan that is more than your own savings.

faqs.question: Are loan interests standard to all borrowers?
faqs.answer:
No, Mombo Sacco leverages risk-based lending to ensure all borrowers have access to loan facilities based on their credit profiles. Good credit profiles earn borrowers higher loan limits with longer durations and lower interest rates. On the other hand, poor credit profiles give a borrower lower loan limits, shorter durations, and slightly higher interest rates.

Refer to the M-Score page to view your loan limits.

faqs.question: Can I change my monthly loan repayment amount?
faqs.answer:
Yes… well, sort of.
Your monthly repayments will go down if you pay extra towards your loan.
But it's impossible to pick a new amount from scratch because your Loan Contract is a fixed agreement. This helps us responsibly plan the money that goes into and out of Mombo Sacco.
You can, however, consolidate or restructure the loan to achieve your objective. Tap on the loan, then consolidate or reduce amount and follow the prompts.

faqs.question: Can I consolidate my loans?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can. To consolidate two or more existing Mombo loans.
First, you'll need to log into your Mombo app. Tap on Loan Services> Consolidate. Once there, select the loans which need consolidation and follow the prompts.
As with your original loan, the application will be subject to our standard credit checks, and you can only borrow up to the maximum loan allowance provided by M-Score.

faqs.question: Can I offset my existing loan from savings?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can.
First, you'll need to log into your Mombo app. Tap on the loan the offset loan button and follow the prompts.

Things to keep in mind:
a. Your existing loan (s) balance should not be more than 97% of your total savings.
b. There is a convenience fee charged.

faqs.question: Can I make extra payments towards my loan?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you may make as many as you wish, with a discount on interest and no penalty fees.
To make an additional payment via the app, please sign in to your Mombo account, tap PayNow, input an amount in the loan field, and follow the on-screen instructions.

Consider the following: 
a. An extra payment reduces your loan balance, decreases the total interest you pay, and reduces the size of your monthly payments.
b. The duration of your loan will remain unchanged.
c. The minimum cost is Ksh50.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide proof of income documentation to access credit?
faqs.answer: Yes, every borrower must provide documentation of income in order for the credit team to construct the borrower's credit profile. This credit profile is crucial for determining the loan terms, including the loan amount, term, and interest rate.

faqs.question: What to consider when choosing a lender?
faqs.answer:
First, always borrow money from a recognized and trustworthy organization.Check reviews and ratings while comparing lenders. Independent reviews are the easiest way. Make sure you read all reviews, good and bad. Moderate reviews usually provide you a balance of pros and cons.

You may want the lowest interest rates, lowest costs, or most affordable and flexible repayment arrangements. These factors are not all-important. A lender with higher interest rates may also be a viable choice. Refinancing with them may be easier if they are your current lender.
Customer support is another feature that simplifies lender selection. For a lender that will pick up the phone and talk to you when you need them, paying a little more on interest rates can be worth it.
If you've discovered many lenders that meet all of these criteria, the following question is whether they offer early payout without costs.

Paying off your debt early can save you hundreds in interest. The more interest you pay, the more you pay above the initial cash advanced.
Finally, choosing a lender may be summed up in one word: flexibility. 

Your ideal lender will be flexible on interest rates, repayments, and loan customization. If you know you don't meet most lenders' one-size-fits-all standards, this will make life easier.

faqs.question: Whats my loan balance?
faqs.answer: On the homepage, navigate to the My loans section to view your active loans. Tap the graph to reveal additional information about your loan. Additionally, you can obtain your loan statement.

faqs.question: Do late payments affect my M-Score?
faqs.answer: Generally, timely bill payment is the most important factor in determining a high M-Score. Being late on any bill for any period of time is a possible indicator of future nonpayment of debt, and Mombo Sacco almost always views this negatively. Any delinquent payments will remain on your M-Score report for as long as seven years.

faqs.question: How does My M-Score affect my ability to get credit?
faqs.answer: A higher M-Score, ranging from 1 to 100, with 1 being the lowest, will reflect a positive CRB rating and financial history, allowing you to access more credit (up to 5X savings) with extended loan terms and favorable interest rates.

faqs.question: What is a Credit Score?
faqs.answer: A credit score is a numeric representation of a credit report's credit history. The number represents the probability that you will default on a loan or credit obligation in the near future.

faqs.question: What is M-Score?
faqs.answer: M-Score is a credit score developed by Mombo Sacco that applies unconventional rich data to the core underwriting model, thus expanding the lending space for individuals who were previously deemed "thin file" or "risky" when binary credit data was used to evaluate them by established financial services providers.

faqs.question: Why dont I have an M-Score?
faqs.answer: The M-Score model cannot generate a score without sufficient credit and financial data. If you have limited or no credit and financial history with Mombo Sacco, you presumably will not have access to an M-Score. Keep your Mombo Sacco account active for at least three months to receive an M-Score.

faqs.question: Does having a high M-Score guarantee approval?
faqs.answer: A high M-Score is not always indicative of acceptance. A credit score is a leading indicator of a person's fundamental creditworthiness. Although many additional factors, such as an applicant's income versus the size of the loan, are considered when determining whether or not you will receive the credit for which you have applied.

faqs.question: How often do M-Score change?
faqs.answer: Your M-Score will fluctuate as your credit report is updated. Since new information is continually being added to your credit report, it is frequently subject to change.

faqs.question: What factors contribute to my M-Score?
faqs.answer: Multiple factors contribute to your M-score being what it is. First, 25% is contributed by transaction behavior - utility payments, expenditures at Till/ Paybill, and payment behavior derived primarily from mobile money history. Second, 25% is contributed by CRB data, which is a combination of demographic information, product holding, and repayment behavior for existing borrowers with other lenders. Lastly, your deposits and loan repayment transaction history with Mombo Sacco contributes 50%. In M-Score, information such as ethnicity, gender, residence, and marital status are not considered.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of M-Score to members?
faqs.answer: M-Score has infused the transactions with transparency. The information obtained from members allows us to personalize pricing and offers for each customer. On the savings side, we can offer discounts by having the system select early savings or early loan repayments, which award customers a 50% discount on the charged interest rate.

faqs.question: What is a good M-Score?
faqs.answer: Your M-score can range between 1 and 100. The interpretation of the scores is as follows: Above 76 indicates excellent credit, 51-75, decent credit, 16-50, fair credit, and 1-15, poor credit.

faqs.question: What is Mombo App?
faqs.answer:
The concept behind Mombo App was to create a simple financial technology, an alternative to traditional banks and Saccos, essentially a super mobile app with an affixed card that grants users complete financial independence.

Mombo App is the engine that drives Mombo Sacco and its partners' services.

faqs.question: How do I reach customer service?
faqs.answer:
You can reach Mombo Sacco customer service by emailing support@mombo.africa or WhatsApp at +254706 323 050. 

Our office is open from Monday to Friday, 8 AM – 5 PM EAT, and Saturday, 8 AM – 1 PM EAT (Excluding public holidays)

faqs.question: What is SASRA?
faqs.answer: The SACCO Societies Regulatory Authority (SASRA) is the primary regulatory body in the Republic of Kenya tasked with licensing Deposit-Taking Sacco Societies (Savings and Credit Co-operatives Societies) - DT regulation 2010 and authorizing specified Non Deposit taking saccos - NDTS Regulations 2021.

faqs.question: When was Mombo Sacco registered?
faqs.answer: In 2014, a group of entrepreneurs conceived of a novel type of Sacco and conceived of MOMBO Sacco as a result. A Sacco that acknowledged and embraced technological advancements in the financial services industry at the time. Mombo Sacco was finally incorporated on February 20, 2015.

faqs.question: What is a Sacco?
faqs.answer: A Sacco is a member-owned financial cooperative society whose purpose is to pool savings from members and use the funds to provide them with affordable credit.

faqs.question: Who are the owners of Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: The acronym SACCO stands for Savings and Credit Cooperative Society. Mombo SACCO is a member-based financial institution that is owned and managed by its members, who also serve as its shareholders and customers.

faqs.question: What do I need to open a Mombo Sacco Flexible savings account?
faqs.answer:
Set aside five minutes and have the following information handy to make filling out your application as simple as possible:
a. An identification document – national ID or valid passport b. A recent passport photo 
c. One-time registration fees of Ksh 200, Ksh 1,000, Ksh 1,500, Ksh 2,000, and Ksh 2,000, respectively, for a Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Emerald savings account.

If you experience any issues with the application, please email us at support@mombo.africa or contact us via WhatsApp at +254706 503230, and we will resolve them immediately. We are here to aid you!

faqs.question: How do I apply for a Mombo Sacco account?
faqs.answer:
To apply, download the MOMBO app from either the Play store or App store.

Launch the application, tap I am new to Mombo button, and follow the prompts to register a free MOMBO account. Once logged in, click on apply for savings plan button. Follow the prompts to submit your application. It should take you no more than five minutes!

If you have any issues with the application, email us at support@mombo.africa, and we’ll get right on it. We are here to help!

faqs.question: Why Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer:
Here are some reasons to contemplate saving with us:

1. Convenience
You can open an account with Mombo Sacco using your mobile device in less than ten minutes. Our user-friendly application enables you to begin saving immediately and without difficulty.

2. Transparency
You can access your account information and terms and conditions directly from your mobile device. We believe in complete openness and will ensure you have complete visibility into your savings.

3. Profit Rates That Compete
Mombo Sacco offers the highest market-average fixed returns on deposits. Profit from appealing interest rates that expedite your money's growth.

4. Flexibility
Choose from a variety of flexible savings accounts that correspond to your current financial capabilities and goals. Whether you are a beginner or a seasoned investor, we have the appropriate account for you.

5. Insurance
Your savings with Mombo Sacco are insured by Kenya's premier insurance provider. You can rest easy knowing that your hard-earned money is safeguarded, giving you peace of mind.

6. Financial Literacy
Utilize our Mombo app to gain access to a wealth of financial education resources. Benefit from Stadi, our artificial intelligence assistant, which provides customized advice and insights to assist you in making informed financial decisions.

7. Reasonable Loan Services
As a member of Mombo Sacco, you have access to affordable loan options. Receive interest savings for each advance payment made. It's all about establishing a secure financial future through savings.

faqs.question: Can I get Mombo Sacco's by-laws?
faqs.answer:
SACCO Bylaws are the fundamental principles and laws of a SACCO that determine the powers and responsibilities of the Management and guarantee the members' rights. 

Follow this link to view Mombo Sacco by-laws https://mombo.co.ke/legal-documentation/

faqs.question: Who is Mombo Sacco CEO?
faqs.answer: Mombo Sacco does not have a CEO. Mombo Sacco has a Sacco Manager, Mr. Stephen Wahito, who is accountable to the Board and supervisory committee for day-to-day operations.

faqs.question: What is Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: At Mombo Sacco, we are more than just a financial institution. We are a trusted partner, a beacon of hope, and a catalyst for positive change in the lives of our members. With a proud legacy of serving the community, we are a modern and inclusive cooperative society that puts people first. Our commitment to digital innovation and personalized services sets us apart in the industry, ensuring that our members can access the financial solutions they need with ease and convenience.

faqs.question: What is Mombo SACCO's mission?
faqs.answer: Our mission is to offer products that fit our customers' and their families' lifestyles, helping them achieve their goals and protect their future.

faqs.question: Who regulates Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: The Commissioner of Cooperatives regulates Mombo Sacco, which is governed by its By-Laws, Sacco Board, and Supervisory Committee.

faqs.question: What is Mombo SACCO's vision?
faqs.answer: Our vision is to provide innovative and inclusive financial solutions that remove barriers, empower people, and promote financial well-being for all.

faqs.question: When I sign up for the app, am I applying for a Mombo Sacco account?
faqs.answer:
No! When you sign up for MOMBO App, no MOMBO Sacco account is created.

To establish a MOMBO Sacco account, tap the apply for a savings plan button and submit your application as instructed. It ought to take no longer than five minutes!

faqs.question: What is the governance structure of Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: Mombo Sacco Society is governed by seven elected directors, including four Executive Directors, three Board of Directors, and three members of a supervisory committee. The Sacco's operations are managed by a competent group of staff members under the direction of the Sacco Manager.

faqs.question: Do you check my credit history when I apply for a Mombo Sacco account?
faqs.answer: No, we do not examine your credit history when you apply for a Mombo Sacco account; therefore, opening an account will not impact your credit score.

faqs.question: How do I contact Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer: Mombo Sacco can be reached by telephone, WhatsApp, or email at +254706503230 and support@mombo.africa.

faqs.question: How do I switch my savings account (s) to Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer:
We would adore for you to save with us.

Even if you dislike the fees or service of your current savings account, you may be reluctant to transfer due to the inconvenience. We understand. Switching savings accounts can be time-consuming, but it's a crucial relationship to maintain. Moving to the appropriate savings account may not only save you money with no fees, but also provide you with peace of mind by saving you time, providing you with convenience, and providing you with superior customer service.

To switch to Mombo Sacco, simply download the Mombo app and submit an application to begin saving.

Please email us at support@mombo.africa if you have any questions, and we will be glad to assist you.

faqs.question: Do I need to apply for a Mombo Sacco account to use Mombo App?
faqs.answer:
No, you do not need a Mombo Sacco account to access multiple services from our financial partners in the marketplace. 

It is essential to note, however, that the Mombo Sacco account is an integral part of what makes the Mombo app so wonderful, and we want you to have the best possible experience.

faqs.question: Can everybody have a Mombo Sacco account?
faqs.answer:
However, there are a few essential requirements. We can only offer accounts to citizens and residents of Kenya who are at least 18 years old and have a valid national identification number. Existing account holders are eligible to establish an Explorer savings account for children. You will also require a device capable of running our app. Currently, MOMBO App is compatible with the following devices:
Apple iPhones running iOS 13 or later b. Android devices running Android OS 4.0 marshmallow or later with access to the Google Play Store.

faqs.question: How do I close my Goal savings account?
faqs.answer: Each account will be automatically closed on its appointed maturity. The outstanding savings deposit and profit will be automatically paid to your established Bank or M-Pesa account.

faqs.question: Why do I need next of kin?
faqs.answer:
The Sacco Act expects every account holder to nominate a next of kin who shall benefit from his sacco contributions less any liabilities in the unfortunate event of an account holder's demise.
Tap on the My Profile menu, then add next of kin. You may add as often and as many kins as you deem fit.

faqs.question: How do I close my Flexible saving account?
faqs.answer:
According to the Sacco Act, you are expected to issue a 60-day notice to close your Flexible savings account. Upon expiry of such, Mombo Sacco will refund both your share capital and savings deposits, less any liabilities and service charges within 30 days.

We’re continually improving, so we encourage you to keep your account open to see what we do next. However, if you would like to close your Savings Account, we will do everything we can to make the closure process hassle-free.
First, settle outstanding loans and withdraw your funds from Explorer savings accounts.

Once you’re ready to close your account, tap on the My Profile menu > close tab. Once there, enter your reason and submit

faqs.question: How do I open a Mombo Sacco Goal savings account?
faqs.answer:
It's simple and easy to open a Sprint or Marathon Goal Account. Our mobile app has an easy-to-use design that will help you set up your account and keep track of your progress as you go.
Come save with us at Mombo Sacco and see how powerful saving can be. Let us be your trustworthy partner as you run fast to reach short-term goals or run slowly to reach long-term goals.
Our customer service team is here to help you if you have any questions or need more information. Contact us right away, and we'll help you make your cash goals come true.

faqs.question: When do I start earning profit on my Goal savings account?
faqs.answer: As soon as you put money in there. The sooner you start, the better!

faqs.question: What is Sprint Goal savings accounts?
faqs.answer:
If you want to save money for things right away, the Sprint Goal Account is for you. This account will provide an immediate boost to your savings, whether you're putting money down for a vacation, a special occasion, or an emergency. 
Short-term savings with easy access to your money will help you achieve your goals more quickly. 
Get access to competitive interest rates and swiftly reach your financial goals.

faqs.question: Are my saving deposits KDIC insured?
faqs.answer: No, since we are not a bank or microfinance. In the meantime, before the Sacco Deposit Guarantee Fund policy is implemented, Mombo Sacco has partnered with Britam Life Insurance Company to insure 100% of your saving deposit at no extra cost. This is a life insurance cover against death and permanent and total disability (PTD). Mombo Sacco is the first and only Sacco in Kenya that insures member deposits.

faqs.question: When do we earn profit on our M-Chama savings?
faqs.answer: Your account shall be eligible to earn monthly profit when you have purchased the full minimum shares (500) or when you have saved the minimum monthly saving per saving plan whichever comes first.

faqs.question: What is a Mombo Sacco M-Chama savings account?
faqs.answer:
Mombo Sacco offers five group savings accounts specifically designed for corporates, Chamas, and groups. These accounts provide regular saving opportunities, attractive monthly returns, and access to development loan facilities. The monthly returns accumulate and can be withdrawn annually. Members can hold only one account at a time.

•	Stawi: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 10,000 with a profit rate of 4% per annum.
•	Shaba: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 30,000 with a profit rate of 6% per annum.
•	Fedha: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 50,000 with a profit rate of 7% per annum.
•	Dhahabu: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 100,000 with a profit rate of 8% per annum.
•	Zumaridi: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 300,000 with a profit rate of 9% per annum.

faqs.question: How do I apply for a savings account?
faqs.answer:
Easy. On the Home page in the app, you’ll see an invitation to “Apply for a savings plan.” Tap, select a saving plan of choice, and submit your identification documents. You will receive a decision in minutes.

It would be best if you have Flexible savings account to apply for an Explorer saving account as well.

faqs.question: What is a flexible saving account?
faqs.answer:
Individual members have the opportunity to choose from our five flexible savings accounts. Each account allows you to save regularly based on your ability and financial goals. These accounts offer a decent monthly return that accumulates over time and can be withdrawn annually. 

Additionally, members enjoy the benefits of affordable loan facilities and free life insurance. Please note that members can hold only one account at a time.

•	Bronze: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 500 with a profit rate of 4% per annum.
•	Silver: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 2,500 with a profit rate of 4.5% per annum.
•	Gold: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 5,000 with a profit rate of 5% per annum.
•	Platinum: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 10,000 with a profit rate of 6% per annum.
•	Emerald: Minimum monthly saving of Ksh 30,000 with a profit rate of 8% per annum.

Join Mombo Sacco today and unlock the power of easy, rewarding, and secure savings. Start your journey towards financial freedom with a trusted cooperative society that puts your needs first.

faqs.question: What types of saving accounts are offered by Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer:
Mombo Sacco offers three (3) types of savings accounts as follows:

1. Flexible Saving accounts for individual members.
2. M- Chama Saving accounts for group/corporate members.
3. Goal Saving accounts for both individual and group members.

faqs.question: Can I pause my saving with Mombo Sacco?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can stop saving anytime and start again when ready. You’re in control. This shall not affect your M-Score.

Tap on saving services, then select pause saving and follow the prompts on the screen.

faqs.question: Whats my savings balance?
faqs.answer: To view your active savings accounts, navigate to the My Savings section of the homepage. Tap the graphs to examine additional account information and perform specific actions. Importantly, you can obtain your savings account statement.

faqs.question: How do I deposit savings?
faqs.answer:
Through the Mombo app, you can deposit stocks and savings. Tap the Pay Now icon and follow the on-screen instructions. Alternately, you may make a bank deposit or use M-Pesa Paybill.

faqs.question: When is profit paid on my savings account?
faqs.answer:
Profit is earned daily and then accrued monthly to your profit account. 

The cumulated profit for the Flexible savings account is paid once annually – in January.

The cumulated profit on the Explorer savings account is paid at the beginning of every calendar quarter.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of a  Mombo Sacco Goal savings account?
faqs.answer:
•	Goal-based Savings: Members can create specific goals within their main goal account, allowing them to allocate funds towards different objectives and track their progress.
•	Easy Fund Transfer: Members can transfer funds in and out of their goal accounts without affecting the main goal account balance, providing flexibility and control over their savings.
•	Competitive Interest Rates: The Sprint Goal Account offers a competitive interest rate of 6%, allowing members to earn returns on their short-term savings. The Marathon Goal Account offers a higher interest rate of 8% for long-term savings, maximizing growth potential.
•	Redemption Flexibility: The Short-Term Goal Account allows for quick redemption within 48 hours, providing access to funds when needed. The Long-Term Goal Account offers the option to lock funds for a specific period, promoting disciplined savings and potentially higher returns.
•	Access to full Sacco Benefits upon payment of Sacco Membership obligations
•	Personalized Financial Planning: Members can set realistic savings targets, monitor progress, and receive personalized financial guidance to stay on track towards achieving their goals.

faqs.question: When do I earn profit on my Flexible saving accounts?
faqs.answer: Your account shall be eligible to earn monthly profit when you have purchased the full minimum shares (200) or when you have saved the minimum monthly saving per saving plan whichever comes first.

faqs.question: How is profit calculated on my savings account?
faqs.answer: We use the daily balance method. First, we calculate a daily periodic rate; then apply it to the principal (the amount you deposited). The regular everyday rate is calculated by dividing the profit rate by 365 days, or 366 days in leap years. TnCs apply.

faqs.question: Whats is a Mombo Sacco Marathon Goal savings account?
faqs.answer:
Endurance savings for Long-Term success.
The Marathon Goal Account is made for goals that will take a long time to reach and will require patience and consistency. If you want to buy a car or a house, pay for your child's college schooling, or save up for retirement, this account is a good partner. Set aside money for a certain amount of time and watch it grow gradually, like a strong marathon runner crossing the finish line.
Invest in long-term savings and fix your money for long times to get the most growth out of your money. Get good interest rates on your savings and watch them grow over time. Prepare for a good future by making sure your finances are stable.

faqs.question: Can I change my Flexible saving account?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your saving account at no extra cost. TnCs apply.

Login to Mombo App, tap on saving services, then change your saving plan.
